Anticipated schedule (subject to change)

WILD 6900: Applied Bayesian Analysis of Ecological Data

Spring 2019

schedule.Rmd
Week (dates) Lecture topic Lab topic Reading
1 (Jan. 8 & 10) Intro to statistical modeling in ecology Introduction to R/RStudio and GitHub H&H chp. 1
2 (Jan. 15 & 17) Probability models and stochasticity Importing, manipulating and tidying data in R/Crash course on R Markdown H&H chp. 2
3 (Jan. 22 & 24) Principles of Bayesian inference Data simulation techniques/Visualization data using ggplot2 H&H chp. 3
4 (Jan. 29 & 31) Simple linear models: t-test, ANOVA, and linear regression Introduction to JAGS/ Regression analysis using JAGS H&H chp. 4
5 (Feb. 5 & 7) Generalized linear models/Hierarchical models Poisson and binomial GLMMs for count & presence/absence data H&H chp. 5, K&S chps. 3-4
6 (Feb. 12 & 14) Process variation vs. observation error/Sampling design State-space count models K&S chp. 12
7 (Feb. 19 & 21) Estimating abundance from count data Basic N-mixture model & variations
8 (Feb. 26 & 28) Review/midterm Buffer
9 (Mar. 5 & 7) Spring break - no class Static and dynamic occupancy models K&S chp. 13
10 (Mar. 12 & 14) Estimating occupancy from presence/absence data Spring break - no class K&S chp. 6
11 (Mar. 19 & 21) Estimating abundance from mark-recapture data M_0, M_t, M_b, and M_h models in JAGS K&S chp. 7
12 (Mar. 26 & 28) Estimating survival from mark-recapture data Cormack-Jolly-Seber model/Individual projects K&S chp. 10
13 (Apr. 2 & 5) Estimating survival, recruitment, and abundance from mark-recapture data Jolly-Seber model/Individual projects K&S chp. 10
14 (Apr. 9 & 11) Introduction to age-structured data/integrated population models IPM model in JAGS/Individual projects K&S chp. 11
15 (Apr. 16 & 18) Integrated population models (cont.)/Student presentations Population viability analysis using IPMs/Individual projects TBD
16 (Apr. 23 & 25) Student presentations (cont.) No lab

Developed by Clark Rushing.
